text:
'PROMISING PRACTICES" - FILM 4
PAGE 14
VIDEO
AUDIO
45. ATTRACTIVE BUT STUDIOUS
LOOKING BOY. . . AT SCIENCE
TABLE. HE IS LOOKING
REFLECTIVE.
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) Can this
boy develop the self-directing skills. . .
the disciplined strategies needed to
stimulate mature, productive thinking.
DISSOLVE TO
46. MS. NARRATOR AT DESK.
NARRATOR: (SYNC) It is to the service
of these and other vital needs that we
must bring the best of our educational
resources. . . used in the best possible
ways.
Foremost among them are our unique
human resources. . . our teachers. . .
DISSOLVE TO
47. MS. MALE TEACHER 1
"HOUSEKEEPING" FOR
TAPE RECORDER. . .
REWINDING TAPE. . .
REMOVING REEL. . .
CLOSING UP CASE, ETC.
NARRATOR: (OFFSCREEN) This
teacher, for instance, can weave the
words of our language into a tapestry
of sounds...and enchant reluctant readers
. . . (PAUSE). . . when there is time.
FADE OUT
FADE IN
